IRS990.MissionDescription: TO WORK IN PARTNERSHIP WITH CHARITABLY-MINDED CITIZENS TO STRENGTHEN MAINE COMMUNITIES.
IRS990.Description: OPERATION OF A STATEWIDE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION TO RECEIVE AND ACCEPT PROPERTY TO BE ADMINISTERED EXCLUSIVELY FOR CHARITABLE PURPOSES, PRIMARILY IN, OR FOR THE BENEFIT OF THE COMMUNITIES OF THE STATE OF MAINE, INCLUDING BUILDING PERMANENT CHARITABLE FUNDS, CONNECTING DONORS TO ORGANIZATIONS AND PROGRAMS THEY CARE ABOUT, MAKING EFFECTIVE GRANTS, AND PROVIDING LEADERSHIP TO ADDRESS COMMUNITY NEEDS.

Form990ScheduleCPartIV.Explanation: A MINIMAL AMOUNT OF GRANTS RECEIVED BY GRANTEE ORGANIZATIONS ARE USED FOR PERMISSIBLE LOBBYING PURPOSES.

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF INTENDED USE OF ENDOWMENT FUNDS:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: VARIOUS CHARITABLE GRANTMAKING PURPOSES IN THE STATE OF MAINE

Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Identifier: DESCRIPTION OF UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS UNDER FIN 48:
Form990ScheduleDPartXIV.Explanation: MAINE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION PAYS UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME TAXES ON INCOME FROM CERTAIN TYPES OF TRANSACTIONS WITHIN INVESTMENT PARTNERSHIPS. IN CERTAIN CIRCUMSTANCES, TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS MAY BE REQUIRED TO RECORD AN OBLIGATION FOR INCOME TAXES AS THE RESULT OF A TAX POSITION THEY HAVE HISTORICALLY TAKEN ON VARIOUS TAX EXPOSURE ITEMS INCLUDING UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME OR TAX STATUS. UNDER GUIDANCE ISSUED BY THE FINANCIAL ACCOUNTING STANDARDS BOARD, ASSETS AND LIABILITIES ARE ESTABLISHED FOR UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS TAKEN OR POSITIONS EXPECTED TO BE TAKEN IN INCOME TAX RETURNS WHEN SUCH POSITIONS ARE JUDGED TO NOT MEET THE "MORE-LIKELY-THAN-NOT" THRESHOLD, BASED UPON THE TECHNICAL MERITS OF THE POSITION. ESTIMATED INTEREST AND PENALTIES, IF APPLICABLE, RELATED TO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS ARE INCLUDED AS A COMPONENT OF INCOME TAX EXPENSE. MANAGEMENT HAS EVALUATED THE FOUNDATION'S TAX POSITIONS AND CONCLUDED THAT THE FOUNDATION HAS MAINTAINED ITS TAX-EXEMPT STATUS, DOES NOT HAVE ANY SIGNIFICANT UNRELATED BUSINESS INCOME AND HAS TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT TO THE CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. WITH FEW EXCEPTIONS, THE FOUNDATION IS NO LONGER SUBJECT TO INCOME TAX EXAMINATIONS BY THE U.S. FEDERAL OR STATE TAX AUTHORITIES FOR YEARS BEFORE 2007.

Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Identifier: PROCEDURE FOR MONITORING GRANTS IN THE U.S.:
Form990ScheduleIPartIV.Explanation: SCHEDULE I, PART I, LINE 2: GRANT PAYMENTS TO ORGANIZATIONS ARE INITIATED BY RECOMMENDATION FROM A DONOR OR REVIEW COMMITTEE OR BY THE TERMS OUTLINED IN THE FUND AGREEMENT. GRANTS INITIATED BY A DONOR OR REVIEW COMMITTEE ARE AUTHORIZED VIA A GRANT RECOMMENDATION FORM OR MINUTES OF THE COMMITTEE MEETING. GRANTS INITIATED BY THE FUND AGREEMENT ARE SCHEDULED FOR PAYMENT ACCORDING TO THE TERMS SET FORTH IN THE FUND AGREEMENT. PRIOR TO AWARDING A GRANT A DETERMINATION IS MADE THAT THE ORGANIZATION IS A 501(C)(3) OR A PUBLIC ORGANIZATION IN GOOD STANDING. FOR GRANTS TO ORGANIZATIONS, AN AWARD LETTER IS SENT WITH EACH GRANT CHECK. THE AWARD LETTER CLEARLY STATES THE PURPOSE OF THE GRANT AND THE TERMS OF THE AWARD WHICH INCLUDE THAT THE ORGANIZATION WILL USE THE GRANT ONLY FOR THE PURPOSE STATED IN THE LETTER. THE AWARD LETTER ALSO STATES THAT BY DEPOSITING THE GRANT CHECK, THE ORGANIZATION AGREES TO AND ACCEPTS THE TERMS OF THE AWARD. THERE ARE SEVERAL FOLLOW-UP ACTIVITIES EMPLOYED TO MONITOR THE USE OF GRANT FUNDS TO ORGANIZATIONS. FOR GRANTS ISSUED FROM A FIELD OF INTEREST FUND, THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVING THE GRANT IS EXPECTED TO PREPARE A PROJECT EVALUATION. DONORS MAY REQUEST PROJECT EVALUATIONS FOR GRANTS ISSUED BY DONOR ADVISED FUNDS. SOME OF THE AWARDING COMMITTEES MEET WITH GRANT RECIPIENTS. WORKSHOPS AND PLANNING SESSIONS ARE OFFERED FOR SOME OF THE GRANT RECIPIENTS. IN SOME CASES, RECIPIENTS OF GRANTS FROM DESIGNATED FUNDS ARE REQUIRED TO SUBMIT A REPORT BEFORE RECEIVING ADDITIONAL GRANT MONEY. GRANT PAYMENTS TO INDIVIDUALS ARE INITIATED BY INDIVIDUAL HIGH SCHOOLS OR SCHOLARSHIP RECOMMENDATION COMMITTEES USING A RECOMMENDATION FORM. A TERMS OF AWARD LETTER IS SENT TO EACH STUDENT WHO IS AWARDED A SCHOLARSHIP. THE STUDENT MUST SIGN AND RETURN THE LETTER, CONFIRMING THE SCHOOL HE/SHE WILL BE ATTENDING. IF THE STUDENT DOES NOT REPLY THE AWARD IS RESCINDED. FOR ALL SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS TO INDIVIDUALS, THE CHECK IS MADE PAYABLE TO BOTH THE INSTITUTION AND THE STUDENT AND IS MAILED TO THE INSTITUTION. ALONG WITH THE CHECK, A LETTER ADDRESSED TO THE INSTITUTION AND THE STUDENT IS SENT EXPLAINING THE SPECIFIC PURPOSE OF THE AWARD AND THE TIMEFRAME IT COVERS. THE STUDENT IS REQUIRED TO SIGN AND RETURN A COPY OF THIS LETTER.

Form990ScheduleMPartII.Explanation: MAINE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION USES A THIRD PARTY BROKER TO SELL STOCK GIFTS AND QUALIFIED ART GALLERIES TO DISPOSE OF GIFTS OF ART. GIFTS OF REAL ESTATE AND OTHER UNIQUE CHARITABLE GIFTS ARE RECEIVED AND LIQUIDATED BY MAINE COMMUNITY SUPPORTING FOUNDATION, A SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION. ONCE LIQUIDATED, THE PROCEEDS ARE TRANSFERRED FROM THE SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION TO MAINE COMMUNITY FOUNDATION.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 4
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE FOLLOWING CHANGES WERE MADE TO THE FOUNDATION'S BYLAWS: 1. ARTICLE III, SECTION 3.2: RENAMED FROM VACANCIES TO REMOVAL OF DIRECTORS, FURTHER CLARIFIED REMOVAL OF A DIRECTOR FROM THE BOARD 2. ARTICLE III, SECTION 3.3(C): DEFINED QUORUM OF THE BOARD FOR MEETING PURPOSES 3. ARTICLE IV, SECTION 4.1: AMENDED TO ALLOW THE BOARD TO ELECT THE BOARD CHAIR TO SERVE FOR ONE ADDITIONAL YEAR AFTER SERVING A TWO YEAR TERM 4. ARTICLE V, SECTION 5.1: REDEFINED THE BOARD STANDING COMMITTEES TO BE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, AUDIT COMMITTEE, GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE, INVESTMENT COMMITTEE, AND FINANCE COMMITTEE. 5. ARTICLE V, SECTION 5.2: THE SIZE AND COMPOSITION OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE WAS CHANGED TO BE THE BOARD CHAIR, BOARD VICE CHAIR, FOUNDATION PRESIDENT (EX OFFICIO AND NON-VOTING), AND THREE BOARD DIRECTORS APPOINTED BY THE CHAIR IN CONSULTATION WITH THE PRESIDENT 6. ARTICLE V, SECTION 5.3: FURTHER CLARIFIED AUDIT COMMITTEE RESPONSIBILITY FOR RECOMMENDING AN INDEPENDENT AUDITOR TO THE BOARD TO CONDUCT THE ANNUAL AUDIT OF THE FOUNDATION AND ITS SUPPORTING ORGANIZATIONS AND BOARD RESPONSIBILITY FOR ACTING ON THAT RECOMMENDATION 7. ARTICLE V, SECTION 5.4: RENAMED NOMINATING & LEADERSHIP COMMITTEE TO GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE 8. ARTICLE V, SECTION 5.5: FURTHER CLARIFIED INVESTMENT COMMITTEE RESPONSIBILITY IN EMPLOYING, DELEGATING AUTHORITY, AND MONITORING INVESTMENT MANAGERS. ALSO PERMITS INVESTMENT COMMITTEE TO AUTHORIZE INVESTMENT COMMITTEE CHAIR OR THE TREASURER TO ACT ON BEHALF OF THE INVESTMENT COMMITTEE. 9. ARTICLE V, SECTION 5.6: ADDED NEW SECTION DEFINING RESPONSIBILITIES OF THE FINANCE COMMITTEE 10. ARTICLE V, SECTION 5.7: ALLOWS BOARD TO EXTEND THE TERM OF THE CHAIR OF ANY STANDING COMMITTEE FOR AN ADDITIONAL ONE YEAR TERM AFTER SERVING THREE CONSECUTIVE YEARS 11. ARTICLE VI, SECTION 7.2: SECTION DISCUSSING COUNTY AND/OR REGIONAL FUNDS WAS REMOVED 12. ARTICLE XIII: RECORDS, FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AND AUDITS WAS REMOVED 13. ARTICLE XV: FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT WAS REMOVED 14. ARTICLE XVI: CONTRACTS, CHECKS, DEPOSIT AND FUNDS: SECTION 16.2 CHECKS, DRAFTS, ETC WAS REMOVED, SECTION 16.3 DEPOSITS WAS REMOVED

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE BOARD AUDIT COMMITTEE REVIEWS THE FORM 990 WITH MANAGEMENT PRIOR TO FILING IT WITH THE IRS. A COPY OF FORM 990 IS ALSO SENT ELECTRONICALLY TO ALL OTHER BOARD MEMBERS BEFORE IT IS FILED WITH THE IRS, ALLOWING THEM TIME TO COMMENT IF THEY SO CHOOSE.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: ANNUALLY, DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, AND ALL EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO REVIEW THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND COMPLETE A DISCLOSURE FORM. ON THE DISCLOSURE FORM, THEY ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY KNOWN CONFLICTS OF INTEREST. DIRECTORS ALSO ABSTAIN FROM APPROVING GRANTS TO ANY ORGANIZATION FOR WHICH THEY HAVE AN INTEREST.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE PROCESS FOR DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR THE CEO INCLUDES USE OF AN INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANT, COMPENSATION SURVEY, AND APPROVAL BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE, ACTING AS THE COMPENSATION COMMITTEE AND BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. PERIODIC SURVEYS AND USE OF INDEPENDENT COMPENSATION CONSULTANTS AID IN DETERMINING COMPENSATION FOR OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES. THE FOUNDATION ALSO MAINTAINS SALARY RANGES BY POSITION GRADES.

GeneralExplanation.ReturnReference: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST. THE AUDITED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS, AS WELL AS FORMS 990 AND 990T, ARE ALSO POSTED ON THE FOUNDATION'S WEBSITE.

GeneralExplanation.Identifier: CHANGES IN NET ASSETS OR FUND BALANCES:
GeneralExplanation.Explanation: NET UNREALIZED GAINS ON INVESTMENTS: 20,544,700. REMEASUREMENT OF CHARITABLE GIFT ANNUITIES -1,317,896. RECOVERY OF PRIOR YEAR GRANTS 75,103. TOTAL TO FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 5: 19,301,907.
THE AUDIT PROCESS HAS NOT CHANGED FROM THE PRIOR YEAR.

NameOfDisregardedEntity.BusinessNameLine1: VINCENT B & BARBARA G WELCH SUPPORTING ORGANIZATION
